Class HTTPMessenger

  • java.lang.Object
    • by.zti.incubator.http.HTTPMessenger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RESTMessenger

    public class HTTPMessenger
extends java.lang.Object
implements RESTMessenger
    Provides communication functionality via HTTP protocol
    Since:
    ZTIU 1.1.0
    See Also:
    HTTPConsumable

    • Method Detail

      • createContext

        public void createContext​(java.lang.String contextURL,
                          HTTPConsumable consumable)
        Creates context resolver inside HttpServer instance that is linked to HttpConsumable object
        Parameters:
        contextURL - - String url path to resolve when server request accepted
        consumable - - HTTPConsumable object to link with specific url

      • send

        public byte[] send​(java.lang.String url,
                   byte[] data)
        Sends byte array to a specific url
        Parameters:
        url - - String that represents request url
        data - - Byte array of data that will be send
        Returns:
        Byte array of data containing server response

      • send

        public byte[] send​(byte[] data,
                   java.lang.Object[] args)
            throws RESTException
        RESTMessenger implementation method that sends some byte array data.
        Specified by:
        send in interface RESTMessenger
        Parameters:
        data - - byte[] data to send.
        args - - Object[] implementation specific arguments.
        Returns:
        - byte[] response data.
        Throws:
        RESTException - - if Object[] arguments are invalid.

      • start

        public HTTPMessenger start​(int port)
        Overrides full start(int port, int poolSize) method with poolSize default 10
        Parameters:
        port - - int desired server port
        Returns:
        Same instance for cascading invocation

      • start

        public HTTPMessenger start​(int port,
                           int poolSize)
        Creates HttpServer instance with poolSize connection pool and binds it to specific port. This method MUST be invoked before creating server context! But it can be ignored if you plan to use send(String url, byte[] data) method only
        Parameters:
        port - - int desired server port
        poolSize - - int desired connection pool size
        Returns:
        Same instance for cascading invocation

      • stop

        public void stop​(int delay)
        Invokes server.stop() command on HttpServer instance after a certain delay
        Parameters:
        delay - - int stop delay

        public com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpServer getServer​()
